definition: with one's own eyes/personally
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes

sentences.english: BE, baby yesterday is also individually see, definite is very exquisite.
sentences.chinese: 是，孩儿昨天也是亲眼所见，确实是非常玄妙。

sentences.english: His denial that he had witnessed the accident dumbfounded me.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾亲眼目睹这一事故的发生把我惊呆了。

sentences.english: You're getting really the first time what I'm seeing "extreme have's" and starting to get "have not's"
sentences.chinese: 我真的第一次亲眼看到“极富”和“极贫”现象。

sentences.english: I'll believe it when Isee it.
sentences.chinese: 我要亲眼见到才能相信。

sentences.english: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.
sentences.chinese: 你对仆人说，把他带到我这里来，叫我亲眼看看他。

sentences.english: He watches as the crane is loaded onto a truck.
sentences.chinese: 随后他又亲眼看到吊车装到卡车。

sentences.english: But the war did come. I saw my boyhood friends blown to bits.
sentences.chinese: 但战争来了，我亲眼看到我儿时的伙伴们被炸成碎片。

sentences.english: If Haiti, you'll witness the the ugly side Western paternalism.
sentences.chinese: 而在海地，你会亲眼目睹到西方家长作风的丑陋面。

sentences.english: I know they are up to the challenge — and I plan to be around to see it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他们会迎接这一挑战，我也会亲眼看到的。

sentences.english: I see what the American people are doing today and every day.
sentences.chinese: 我亲眼看到了美国人民今天和以后每一天都在做的事。

sentences.english: Then she told the king, and he determined to watch himself.
sentences.chinese: 于是她就告诉了国王，他决定自己亲眼看看。

sentences.english: I want to see for myself.
FOX was just repeating the information from people who claimed to be eye-witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 但FOX一直在重申，这些信息是目击者亲眼所见。

sentences.english: There's nothing like seeing the whole action flowing back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 这远比不上亲眼看到整个来回的流畅动作。

sentences.english: In my dream, the nameless lake is more colorful and everlasting changing than what I really see.
sentences.chinese: 在梦中，未名要比亲眼所见的，更加绚烂和多变。

definition: to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes
to witness/to see at first hand/to see with one's own eyes
personal/oneself
to gain first-hand knowledge of sth/to experience for oneself/knowledge/experience/insight
to observe and emulate/to study (esp. following sb's example)
devastation/miserable condition
to go in person
Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

definition: to exclaim in astonishment
one's own mouth/fig. in one's own words/to say sth personally
personal experience
portrait/genuine appearance/real face
personally/with one's own hands
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
half believing, half doubting/skeptical
